topic.title: HP Helion Openstack 1.1: Using as an Admin User

body.p: The Admin dashboard enables you to work within the current cloud domain. You can access tools to work with the Compute, Network, Object Operations, and Orchestration services.
As an administrator (admin), you can perform all of the user tasks in addition to the admin tasks.

section.title: Managing Domains
section.p: A domain is a high-level container for projects, users, and groups that defines administrative boundaries for management of those entities. A domain can represent an individual, company, or operator owned space.
For more information, see Managing Domains.

section.title: Managing projects
section.p: You can create new projects and manage existing projects, such as controlling access to projects by assigning roles to users and groups.
For more information, see Managing Projects.

section.title: Managing networks
section.p: A network is a pluggable, scalable system for managing networks and IP addresses.
You can use the dashboards to create, delete, and configure your HP Helion Openstack subnet(s) and ports.
For more information, see Managing Networks.

section.title: Managing users
section.p: You can use the dashboard to create new users, assign users to projects, and change a user password as needed.
For more information, see Managing Users.

section.title: Managing images
section.p: You can use the dashboards to determine if an image snapshot is available only in the current project or to all projects in the domain.
For more information, see Making an Image Public.

section.title: Managing security
section.p: You can use the dashboards to change the password for a user, as needed.
For more information, see Changing a User Password.
